net.viktorc.pspp.core

Interface CommandListener


  • public interface CommandListener
    A listener that allows for the processing of the outputs of a process. It is temporarily subscribed to a #ProcessManager instance when the sendCommand method is called. It listens to the standard out and error out streams of the process and the respective method is invoked every time a new line is printed to one of these streams. Besides possible processing activities, these methods are also responsible for determining when the process finished processing the command. E.g. if a process takes the command "go" which triggers the execution of long-running task, and it prints "ready" to the standard out stream once the task is completed; the methods should only return true if the output "ready" has been written to standard out, in any other case, they should return false.
    Author:
    A6714

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean onNewErrorOutput(java.lang.String errorOutput)
      A method called every time a new line is printed to the error out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
      boolean onNewStandardOutput(java.lang.String standardOutput)
      A method called every time a new line is printed to the standard out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.

    • Method Detail

      • onNewStandardOutput

        boolean onNewStandardOutput(java.lang.String standardOutput)
        A method called every time a new line is printed to the standard out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
        Parameters:
        standardOutput - The new line of output printed to the standard out of the process.
        Returns:
        Whether this line of output denotes that the process has finished processing the previously sent command. The #ProcessManager instance will not accept new commands until the processing of the command is completed.

      • onNewErrorOutput

        boolean onNewErrorOutput(java.lang.String errorOutput)
        A method called every time a new line is printed to the error out stream of the process after a command has been sent to it and it has not finished processing it up until now.
        Parameters:
        errorOutput - The new line of output printed to the error out of the process.
        Returns:
        Whether this line of output denotes that the process has finished processing the previously sent command. The #ProcessManager instance will not accept new commands until the processing of the command is completed.
